venue.name: The Park at the Charles River

item.description:
greetings earthlings!

we're supposed to have a beautiful day on friday here in the boston area. i'm going to try to take advantage of that weather by scheduling an intermediate skate for late friday afternoon.

what's an intermediate skate?

we'll skate at a pretty good pace without stopping, but there won't be anything very tricky; e.g., i don't jump over anything unless it's absolutely necessary. (ask me about the time i had to jump over a bicycle....)

one measure of our pace: we will be skating fast enough to pass almost any runner you'd see going around the river and we may pass the slower cyclers.

we will be going from The Park at the Charles River to the Hatch Shell and back. according to gmaps-pedometer.com, this is about an 8 mile round trip. (see the route here: http://www.gmap-pedom...)

we will stop for traffic and traffic lights as we cross streets and there are a couple of water fountains on the route. (i usually stop for water.)

i'll be at The Park by 5:45p, near the kayak rental stand, and we'll get going at 6:00 sharp. there's ample parking there and i usually park in lot # 2.

see you around the river.
item.how_to_find_us: i'll send an email w/my cell # on friday afternoon, 10 july, to all Yes and Maybe RSVPers
item.name: Intermediate After Work Skate @ The Park at the Charles River
